channel.title: Android on Veehan's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Android on Veehan's Blog

item.title: GoogleCTF 2016 - Little Bobby Application
item.description: Find the vulnerability, develop an exploit, and when you’re ready, submit your APK to https://bottle-brush-tree.ctfcompetition.com. Can take up to 15 minutes to return the result. Firing up the application, the user is presented with a login screen along with a registration button. The title is a reference to an XKCD comic about SQL injection, so it stands to reason that getting to the flag will require some sort of injection along the way.

item.title: GoogleCTF 2016 - Ill Intentions (and Can You Repo It?) Write-up
item.description: Do you have have ill intentions? This is an Android apk. The first thing I do is fire up the application to see what it does. I installed Android Studio and used the included SDK to fire up an Android Virtual Device (AVD). adb install illintentions.apk installs it. Running the app doesn’t do much, but does provide a hint that it can change activities through some Send_to_Activity function (probably an intent)
